initializeRoomMatrix

public void initializeRoomMatrix()
When using a complete map, this matrix holds room data. At each index, the value is equal to the id of the room. If it is not a room, it is tagged as -1;

getState

public java.lang.String getState(edu.cmu.Node w)

print

public void print(int param)
This is useful for seeing what the map currently looks like. param = 0 -- shows whether node is boundary or free space param = 1 -- shows the distance to the goal node (g) param = 2 -- shows the distance to the goal node (rhs) param = 3 -- shows the cost of crossing node

diagCase

public boolean diagCase(int i,
                        int j,
                        int k,
                        int l)
This tests to see if a path is attempting to cut between two diagonal barriers that have no space between them

youngestNeighbor

public int youngestNeighbor(edu.cmu.Node n)
Finds the timestep of the youngest neighbor. This is used before rolling the timeToOPEN back when Path Replanning.

getNeighbors

public java.util.ArrayList<edu.cmu.Node> getNeighbors(edu.cmu.Node n)
Will return all accessible neighbors of node n Assumes person cannot cut through diagonal corridors of width 1 or walk through walls. Sounds like a safe assumption...

getNeighbors

public java.util.ArrayList<edu.cmu.Node> getNeighbors(edu.cmu.Node n,
                                                      char c)
Will return all accessable neighbors of node n with constraint that their set is equal to character c. Assumes person cannot cut through diagonal corridors of width 1 or walk through walls. Sounds like a safe assumption...

initialize

public void initialize()
ALL NODES ARE CREATED AND N CONTAINS POINTERS TO ALL NEIGHBORS ON THE GRID

reinitialize

public void reinitialize()
All nodes are reset but not recreated. This is used when the map is still good, but the path is being recalculated.

The node is along the path of the Graph nodes and will be used in the grid planner.

getBestNode

public edu.cmu.Node getBestNode(edu.cmu.Node Start,
                                edu.cmu.Node End)
Gets the best node of the OPEN set. This node is the most likely candidate for the next step in an optimal solution path. It tries to return a grid cell that is enRoute(), but if it can't, it gives one that isn't. This has been seen to stray from the path of the graph nodes. I'm not entirely sure why. It would be faster if it didn't but it works either way.

cleanUpOpen

public void cleanUpOpen()
Makes sure everything on the open list has the correct set and does not have a parent in the open list.

initializeCostFunction

public void initializeCostFunction(int userSize)
Sets up the cost for each node in the map. This currently only considers the width of the halls. Narrow halls have a higher cost. The way this works: All grid squares adjacent to a wall have a high cost and as the squares get progressively farther from walls, their cost function lowers. This will close off paths when the user is wheelchair bound and may have a size that is larger than a grid cell. These paths can still be found only if no others are available.

mag

public float mag(edu.cmu.Node a,
                 edu.cmu.Node b)
Returns the euclidean distance between two nodes

line_draw

public boolean line_draw(int x0,
                         int y0,
                         int x1,
                         int y1,
                         int[][] ExtraMap,
                         int opt)
Bresenham's line algorithm. When called, it traces the border of a room and looks for open spaces (doors)

getRooms

public java.util.ArrayList<edu.cmu.Room> getRooms()
Getting Data to the Markov Model This is an easy way to get the rooms. They are unchanging throughout the program and their id is the same as their index in the array.

getRoomById

room returned
